conclusion: Analyze motion and conditions for electromagnetic induction.
Square conductor frame with side length l moves uniformly with speed v from left to right through a magnetic field of width d.
Frame starts outside the magnetic field.
Induced current occurs when frame is partially or fully inside the magnetic field as magnetic flux changes.
Frame enters magnetic field when leftmost edge aligns with left boundary.
Frame fully enters magnetic field when entire side length l is within the field.
Time for left side of frame to move distance l into the field is l/v.
Change in flux occurs from entry until rightmost edge exits entry boundary, lasting l/v.
No change in flux when frame is fully inside the magnetic field.
Frame starts to exit when leftmost edge aligns with right boundary.
Frame fully exits when entire side length l is out of the field.
Time for left side of frame to move distance l out of the field is l/v.
Change in flux occurs from start of exit until rightmost edge fully exits, lasting l/v.
Total time for change in magnetic flux is sum of entry and exit phases.
Time for frame to move through width d of magnetic field is d/v.
Total duration of induced current includes entry time l/v, transit time d/v, and exit time l/v.
Final answer considers only when flux changes, simplifying to t = 2l/v.
